official-title.#text: To encourage students from American Samoa, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, and the United States Virgin Islands to become civically engaged through local and Federal Government fellowships.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: Dr. Rita Hocog Inos Territorial Fellowship Act

text.#text: This Act may be referred to as the

header.#text: Fellowship program for students from American Samoa, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, and the United States Virgin Islands

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall carry out a program, to be known as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dr. Rita Hocog Inos Territorial Fellowship Act/s:2/ss:i

quote.#tail: , to award local and Federal Government fellowships to qualified students from those territories, subject to the availability of amounts described in
quote.#text: Dr. Rita Hocog Inos Territorial Fellowship Program

text.#text: To encourage civic engagement among students from American Samoa, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, and the United States Virgin Islands, the
The fellowships that may be awarded under the program are as follows:
A local government fellowship with a cooperating agency or entity of the territory in which the qualified student is domiciled.
A Federal Government fellowship with a cooperating—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 105 of title 5, United States Code

text.#text: The term of a fellowship under the program shall be an academic semester or a summer, as designated by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: or academic credit toward graduation. Such award may also include a travel stipend of not more than $1,500 for each fellowship term, based on the distance of the student awarded the fellowship from the site of the fellowship.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall develop and administer an application and selection process for awarding a fellowship under the program.

header.#text: Limitation on number of fellowships awarded to each student

text.#text: Under the program, a qualified student may be awarded no more than—
one local government fellowship; and
one Federal Government fellowship.
